meanings.definition: Somewhat dark or dim in color.
meanings.sent1: The duskier sky signaled the approaching night.
meanings.sent2: The room looked duskier as the sun set outside.
meanings.sent3: The cat's fur appeared duskier after rolling in the dirt.
meanings.sent4: Her mood grew duskier as the storm clouds gathered.
meanings.sent5: The old painting had a duskier hue due to age and exposure.

meanings.definition: Tending to become dark or dim.
meanings.sent1: The duskier clouds hinted at rain later in the day.
meanings.sent2: The duskier evenings in autumn made the town feel cozy.
meanings.sent3: The plant's leaves turned duskier as winter approached.
meanings.sent4: His jokes took on a duskier tone as the party went on.
meanings.sent5: The duskier shadows lengthened as the sun dipped below the horizon.
